column4: hi, I'm a noob, and I'm trying to get ubuntu working on my lenovo t60p. I can't get it to recognize any internet connection - doesn't think I have a wireless card and when I plug in an ethernet cable the light comes on but ubuntu doesn't see it
: did you configure the network connection?
: try the icon on the top left.
: click on it and select manual config
what will I be able to do from there?
: did you get the window of networking?
I believe I was in the network connections screen
only thing it was seeing was "local loopback"
: well you need to obtain ip address automacilly like in windows
I'll boot into ubuntu and see if I can figure more out, thanks for your help
doy you have a router you connect to for internet?
: Sorry, if you have a wifi prob, and the card is Atheros. then i am no the man.. i have tried getting mine atheros working for a few months now. i gave up..
